page.title: 07The Hamilton Local Plan 1
page.content: In 1971 Leicestershire County Council started planning ahead for the next 20 years. It was preparing a{structure {plan}to consider, amongst other things, the housing needs of the 1980's. The national census provided much of the information and suggested a future need for a large number of homes in the city of Leicester. The council felt that the area to the north-east of Leicester would be suitable. The area to be developed would stretch from Keyham Lane, Humberstone, in the south, to Thurmaston in the west, to Barkby Thorpe and part way to Queniborough in the north and to Beeby in the east. The Minister of the Environment agreed in principle to the plans and asked that a more detailed plan be prepared.
